item.title: @dalton: @isaiah [joke about Gentoo]
item.description: @isaiah [joke about Gentoo]
Two Letters from SJ made a difference to me: http://davidgelphman.wordpress.com/2013/03/29/2-letters-from-steve/ In this case I didn't have to wonder what Steve would have done.

item.title: @dalton: @cycoder I suppose it depends on which layer of abstraction you are talking about. For piping content around, there is IFTTT, Zapier etc. At an API level it's kind of hard to abstract the various social services, right?
item.description: @cycoder I suppose it depends on which layer of abstraction you are talking about. For piping content around, there is IFTTT, Zapier etc. At an API level it's kind of hard to abstract the various social services, right?

item.title:
@dalton: How a Live Nation Deal Cornered Justin Timberlake [www.hollywoodreporter.com]
Interesting look into the brave new music world where an album release helps promote a tour, not the other way around.
item.description: How a Live Nation Deal Cornered Justin Timberlake [www.hollywoodreporter.com] Interesting look into the brave new music world where an album release helps promote a tour, not the other way around.

item.title: @dalton: @cycoder not that I am aware of. I am not sure that would be all that useful at this point. For example, extremely popular frameworks like this already have App.net support: https://github.com/AFNetworking/AFNetworking

item.title: @dalton: @dcurtis the problem with plans like that is always integration, right? I think they would be/were much more likely to acquire the spare parts of Palm/WebOS from HP to build an Android fork. The companies are just down the road from each other
item.description: @dcurtis the problem with plans like that is always integration, right? I think they would be/were much more likely to acquire the spare parts of Palm/WebOS from HP to build an Android fork. The companies are just down the road from each other
